title: Patient Refuses X-rays
summary: A patient declines necessary diagnostic X-rays. Educate and respect choice; document refusal and balance standards with autonomy.

scene.setting: A patient declines necessary diagnostic X-rays. You may feel concerned or impatient; the hidden risk is pressuring them and damaging autonomy and trust. The decision point is push compliance vs educate and respect choice.

beats.narration: The patient has declined. The decision point is insist or explain risks and allow them to decide.

dialogue.speaker: doc
dialogue.line: I want you to understand the risks so you can make an informed choice. I'll document your decision and we may need to limit scope of care accordingly.

choices.label: Insist firmly that X-rays are required for safe care.

steps.step: Explain risks clearly; document refusal; offer to answer questions; clear next step if they change mind.

leader_lines: Here are the risks. I'll document your choice. Here's what we can and can't do without imaging.
questions: How do you hold the standard without pressure?
What's the clear next step if they change mind?
scripts.closing_line: Explain risks; document refusal; limit scope as needed.

choices.label: Explain the risks and allow the patient to decide; document the refusal.

steps.step: Explain risks; allow decision; document refusal (form, chart note, signed consent).
Adjust scope of care if needed; document clearly.

leader_lines: Here are the risks. You get to decide. I'll document and we'll adjust what we can safely do.
scripts.closing_line: Refusal form with risks stated; scope adjusted if needed.

choices.label: Refuse to provide further service until they agree to X-rays.

steps.step: After education and documentation: clear line; clear path if they change mind.

leader_lines: Without imaging I can't safely do X. Here's what happens if you change your mind.
questions: When is refusal the right move?
What's the clear path if they change mind?
scripts.closing_line: After education and documentation; clear path to return.

choices.label: Proceed without X-rays to keep the patient happy.

steps.step: Adopt list of procedures that require imaging; document and limit scope; offer referral if they decline.

leader_lines: We need to hold the line on non-negotiables. Here's our standard.
questions: How do you hold the line?
What do we document and limit?
scripts.closing_line: List of imaging-required procedures; document and limit scope; offer referral.

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you push compliance or educate and respect choice?

outcomes.message: Risk and liability may have increased. Integrity was weakened.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with educate-and-document?
How do you hold the line on non-negotiables?

outcomes.message: Standards and respect are balanced. Patient made an informed choice; integrity preserved.
reflection_questions: When do you limit scope of care?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I educated and respected choice while holding standards. (1-5)
